shapes
Class Shape

java.lang.Object
  shapes.Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
Line, RegularPolygon, Shape2D, Shape3D
public class Shape
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a shape defined by its x and y coordinates.

Version:
9/27/15
Author:
Ashley Helfinstein

Field Detail

x

protected int x

y

protected int y
Constructor Detail

Shape

public Shape(int x,
             int y)
Sets up a shape with a given location. Default stroke is black, fill is white, and stroke weight is 1.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate to set the shape
y - the y coordinate to set the shape
Method Detail

draw

public void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
Draws the shape to the screen, here sets up PApplet to draw

Parameters:
drawer - the PApplet that can draw the shape
Postcondition:
The drawer has state changes. The stroke color is set to the value set in setStrokeColor, the stroke weight is the set to the value set in setStrokeWeight, and the fill color is set to the value set in setFillColor or is set to noFill if noFillWanted() is called.

setStrokeColor

public void setStrokeColor(int r,
                           int g,
                           int b)
Sets stroke color to desired color

Parameters:
r - the R value of the new stroke color (in RGB)
g - the G value of the new stroke color
b - the B value of the new stroke color

setStrokeWeight

public void setStrokeWeight(int weight)
Sets the stroke weight to desired weight

Parameters:
weight - the new weight of the stroke

setFillColor

public void setFillColor(int r,
                         int g,
                         int b)
Sets fill color to desired color

Parameters:
r - the R value of the new fill color (in RGB)
g - the G value of the new fill color
b - the B value of the new fill color

noFillWanted

public void noFillWanted()
Sets fill color to no fill
